It typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories where it relies on specific mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake. The plant produces delicate, greenish-yellow flowers with a short, narrow lip that is characteristic of the genus. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in association with other epiphytic and terrestrial orchids. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
